articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Hardball 1/3/20
articles.description: Chris Matthews and a panel of guests discuss the political news of the day.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: All In 1/3/20
articles.description: Chris Hayes discusses the day's top political news.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Lawrence gives thanks for your KINDness
articles.description: Thanks to your generous contributions, the KIND Fund has reached a new milestone toward helping students in Malawi get desks in their classrooms and scholarships for girls to attend high school.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: McConnell and Schumer in a stalemate over Trump impeachment trial
articles.description: The two political leaders in the Senate started 2020 sparring over how the upper chamber will proceed on Trump's impeachment trial. Mieke Eoyang and Jonathan Allen react.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Asymmetry of Iranian attacks makes defense difficult to plan for
articles.description: Susan Rice, former U.S. national security advisor, talks with Rachel Maddow about whether the U.S is already at war in Iran and whether the Trump administration is doing enough to raise defenses against a threatened retaliatory attack.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: ‘We’ll send the Sergeant at Arms over to the Justice Department’
articles.description: In federal court today, a hypothetical question from a Trump-appointed judge to the House general counsel led to a wild imagining about how a confrontation between the House and the Department of Justice.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: How will Iran respond to Trump-ordered strike on its military leader?
articles.description: NBC News reports that there are multiple different forms a response from Iran could take after Trump ordered the assassination of its military leader, Qassem Soleimani.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Rice: Risks likely outweigh benefits of killing Qassem Soleimani
articles.description: Susan Rice, former U.S. national security advisor, talks with Rachel Maddow about whether the U.S. is likely safer and more secure with Qassem Soleimani dead or to have left him alive and dealt with him another way.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: New evidence bolsters appeal for witnesses at impeachment trial
articles.description: Sen. Chuck Schumer says the impeachment trial must allow witnesses and documents to be presented.  Ali Velshi looks at all the new facts in the case that have been revealed since Trump was impeached 16 days ago.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Fmr. Obama Nat Sec official: No reason to believe Trump admin has plan with Iran
articles.description: Ben Rhodes tells Ali Velshi that he wonders whether President Trump understands that the killing of Qasam Soleimani is an "act of war." He says that, to date, there's no clarity where the Trump administration will take the U.S. beyond this killing.
articles.content: Ben Rhodes tells Ali Velshi that he wonders whether President Trump understands that the killing of Qasam Soleimani is an "act of war." He says that, to date, there's no clarity where the Trump administration will take the U.S. beyond this killing.Jan. 4, 2020

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Day 1,079: Iran vows 'revenge' after Trump-ordered killing of military leader
articles.description: Amid reports of another airstrike in Iraq, Iran is vowing 'revenge' on the United States after Trump ordrered the assassination of its military leader, Qassem Soleimani.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Shiite protests in Baghdad hold potential for conflict with U.S.
articles.description: Richard Engel, NBC News chief foreign correspondent, talks with Rachel Maddow about the outrage Donald Trump has stoked among Shia militia members ahead of planned protests in Baghdad, including one adjacent to the U.S. embassy area.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: US servicemembers abroad at increased risk after Trump Iran...
articles.description: Rachel Maddow notes that there are thousands of American servicemembers within reach of the influence of Iran whose lives are at increased risk after Donald Trump's provocative killing of Iranian General Qassem Soleimani.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Iran's past suggests range of potential threats to US interests
articles.description: Rachel Maddow looks at how Iran has expressed aggression toward the U.S. and U.S. interests in the past as a way of framing what Americans might expect in terms of the new threat provoked by Donald Trump, not the least of which is extensive cyber capabilities.
